newsitem.title: GERMANY: SGL Carbon sees higher sales, profit in 97.
newsitem.headline: SGL Carbon sees higher sales, profit in 97.

text.p: German carbon and graphite manufacturer SGL Carbon AG said on Thursday it expected growth in sales and a double-digit percentage rise in earnings in 1997.

Despite continuing uncertainty about Germany's economic environment, earnings were expected to rise in all three divisions -- special graphite, technology and carbon and graphite -- the company said in a statement.
In the special graphite and technology divisions SGL expected to reach its target of a 15 percent minimum gross return on sales, SGL said.
The company also said it expected to be able to realise a number of acquisition projects which were currently at a preliminary stage of negotiation.
SGL Carbon plans to invest about 130 million marks this year.
